alert.note: Alert for Tarrant (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 1:06AM CDT until October 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Walnut Creek Near Mansfield affecting Tarrant County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walnut Creek near Mansfield. * WHEN...From early this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Major flooding will occur along the creek through Mansfield, downstream of Joe Pool Lake. At 25 feet, several houses near the creek begin to flood. Oliver Nature Park and Town Park are also flooded. Retta Road, North Street, Walnut Creek Road, and Magnolia Road are flooded with several feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.5 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.
